meanings.sent1: She accidentally bittered the soup by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: The lemon juice bittered the taste of the salad just right.
meanings.sent3: After tasting the bittered coffee, he made a funny face.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel bitter or resentful.
meanings.sent1: His harsh words bittered her towards him.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment bittered her attitude towards the company.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said, 'Don't bitter me with your complaints.'
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism bittered their friendship over time.
meanings.sent5: The lost opportunity bittered his outlook on life.
